place.name: BARROWBY
place.gazetteerText: BARROWBY, a parish, with three hamlets, in Grantham district, Lincoln; on the Grantham and Nottingham railway, 1½ mile W of Grantham. It has a post office under Grantham. Acres, 4,462. Real property, £7,969. Pop., 862. Houses, 187. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £1,200.* Patron, the Duke of Devonshire. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
